segments.text: I see the puddle growing beneath the sink and it’s making me really uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is soaking into the cabinets, and I can almost hear the wood groaning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman stands there, blissfully unaware, and it’s infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout at her to look down and see the mess she’s ignoring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every inch of that water creeping toward the kids makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t she take a moment to step back and assess the situation?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But instead, she polishes another dish like everything is just fine.
segments.speaker: PAR
